task-wr.title: Launching Virtual Machine Instances
task-wr.shortdesc: You can launch a virtual machine from the web administration interface or the CLI.

context.p: You can launch a virtual machine from the CLI using the nova boot command. For examples, see .

Note that not all of the options described in the following steps are required. For example, it is possible to launch an instance without defining any post-creation actions. Required tabs and fields are marked with an asterisk (*) in the web interface.

step.cmd: Logged in as a user, navigate to Project Compute Instances and click Launch Instance.

info.p: In the Launch Instance window, select the Details tab.

US69978 mention boot option, to support xref from new topic on Migration Outcomes for Instance Storage Options These options define basic run-time attributes such as name, number of vCPUs, memory and storage, as well as the type of boot source to use (volume or image). For more information, see http://docs.openstack.org/.

For more information, see Titanium Server System Administration: .

note.p: For fast instance booting, use a prepared Cinder volume, and set the Instance Boot Source to Boot from Volume. For more information, see .

info.p: In the Launch Instance window, select the Server Group tab.

Server groups is a mechanism to group virtual machines to which a common set of attributes is applied, such as affinity and anti-affinity behavior. At least one server group must exist to use this option. For more information, see .

step.cmd: Establish access security for the instance.

substep.cmd: In the Launch Instance window, select the Access & Security tab and associate the available tenant's keypair with this instance. A keypair contains SSH credentials that will be added to the image when you launch it. For information, see the Titanium Server Tenant User's Guide: .
Select a security group. Security groups are sets of firewall policies that determine which incoming network traffic is forwarded to the instance. For more information, see .

step.cmd: Specify which networks the image will use.

info.p: In the Launch Instance window, select the Networking tab.

You must choose at least one tenant network over which the instance will communicate. Click the blue + buttons on the Available Networks list to move the tenant networks to the Selected Networks list. For each interface, you can specify the driver type from a drop-down menu.

note.p: The order in which the networks are moved determines the order in which the virtual Ethernet interfaces eth0, eth1, eth2, and so on are assigned.

info.p: For more information on tenant networking concepts, see .

step.cmd: Specify any post-creation actions to take.

info.p: In the Launch Instance window, select the Post-Creation tab.

Enabling the Configuration Drive option will cause Titanium to write metadata to a special configuration drive that attaches to the instance when it boots, making the metadata available. For more information on configuration drives, see .

step.cmd: Click Launch to start the instance.
